DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Ixabepilone is a type of chemotherapy drug called an antimicrotubule agent. It is similar to a natural substance called epothilone B. It kills cells by keeping microtubules (cellular structures that help move chromosomes during mitosis) from working the way they should.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Ixabepilone is approved to be used alone or with capecitabine to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Breast cancer that has spread and cannot be treated with or did not respond to other chemotherapy.

Section.Para: Ixabepilone is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
